answer:
One must have received and logged instruction from an authorized instructor in a high-performance airplane and have been found proficient and  have received a logbook endorsement attesting to that proficiency.  
(If one has logged flight time as PIC prior to 4 August 1997 this training and endorsement is unnecessary.)
14 CFR Part 61.31
question: What must one have done to act as PIC of a high-performance airplane, ie., an airplane with an engine of more than 200 horsepower?
